excerpt: Black Mirror, Doctor Who, The Handmaid's Tale, Hacks and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen over the next seven days.

html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find six new shows (including the Jon Hamm drama Your Friends & Neighbors and the Simu Liu-hosted reality series Got to Get Out), nine returning favorites (including Black Mirror, Doctor Who, Hacks and The Handmaidâ€™s Tale) and 14 finales (including 1923, The Pitt, The White Lotus and Yellowjackets).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, APRIL 6

ðŸ“º 1923 Season 2 finale (Paramount+)

The film explores the untold story of A Goofy Movie, following a young creative team tackling their first Disney feature, its initial disappointment, and its surprising resurgence decades later.

ðŸ¤£ Kill Tony: Kill or Be Killed (Netflix comedy special)

TUESDAY, APRIL 8

ðŸ“º The Clubhouse: A Year With the Red Sox (Netflix, eight-episode binge)
The docuseries follows the Boston Red Sox during the 2024 MLB seasonÂ with unprecedented access to players, coaches and executives.

ðŸ“º Spy High (Prime Video, four-episode binge)
The docuseries explores the story of 15-year-old Blake Robbins, who filed a lawsuit claiming that his prestigious public school was spying on him when he was accused of selling drugs.

ðŸ“º The Handmaidâ€™s Tale final season (Hulu, three-episode premiere)

ðŸ“º 8 pm Finding Your Roots Season 11 finale (PBS)
ðŸ“º 9 pm Denise Richards and Her Wild Things Season 1 finale (Bravo)

WEDNESDAY, APRIL 9

ðŸ“º Bad Influence: The Dark Side of Kidfluencing (Netflix, three-episode binge)
The docuseries explores the shadowy world of child influencers, honing in on the disturbing allegations of abuse surrounding popular internet celebrity Piper Rockelle and her momager, Tiffany Smith.

ðŸ“º Unicorn Academy Chapter 3 (Netflix, 10-episode binge)

ðŸ“º 9 pm Good Cop/Bad Cop Season 1 finale (The CW)

THURSDAY, APRIL 10

ðŸ“º North of North (Netflix, eight-episode binge)
A young Inuk woman wants to build a new future for herself after a spontaneous â€” and extremely public â€” exit from her marriage.

ðŸŽ¥ G20 (Prime Video movie)
When the G20 summit comes under siege, the president of the United States (Viola Davis) becomes the number one target.

FRIDAY, APRIL 11

ðŸ“º Got to Get Out (Hulu, eight-episode binge)
Lies and lunacy collide in this exhilarating competition series where an outrageous mix of reality icons and crafty gamers must conspire to get out; Simu Liu hosts.

ðŸ“º Your Friends & Neighbors (Apple TV+, two-episode premiere)
Jon Hamm plays a disgraced hedge fund manager who resorts to stealing from the homes of his affluent neighbors.

The film shares the legendary story of the 1982 Milwaukee Brewersâ€™ almost-Championship season.

Bryce Dallas Howardâ€™s film explores the extraordinary relationship that exists between animals and their people, all around the world.

ðŸŽ¥ WrestleMania IX: Becoming a Spectacle (Peacock documentary)
A behind-the-scenes look that features never-before-seen footage of the 1993 Las Vegas extravaganza, Wrestlemania IX, that promised fans a WWE event unlike any other.
